posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
You understand it correctly. Even with IKD, gnomes and halflings can, at best, KD large hostiles.

TBH, my halflings use just plain 'ol KD for sneaking on mages and clerics. If they can find a "spare" feat which is rare, then IKD would be a luxury (naturally, a monk like this gets both for free so no issue on that score). The amount of damage a dexer typically is comparatively low compared to a STR build. For a DevCritter... different story. Very handy to get "free" crit attempts in so would go with a medium race in that case.

With an uber AC toon like this, most foes will miss without being prone anyway (except, as I already stated, those dang mages & clerics).

With dual kamas, halfling makes a lot of sense, especially as a stealther (best race for that). Unarmed attack, I would rethink the options a bit more.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
foojin wrote:He gets impr KD, also he has no hide/ms and for damage he does have 9d6 SA. Futhermore he has WoF / Impr invis and other cleric buffs to increase regular non-sa damage a bit.
Well, this is a bit of beating around the bush, trying to guess what build you are trying to assess. It's looking like a dexer monk/cleric/rogue of some sort from your former hints.
Opinions on which of the 2 races to pick would be nice
You only mentioned 1 race so far. What's the other, human? Elf?

It depends on how you intend to implement KD. In mobs, IMO, KD is a waste since you will be continually flanked and that 1 round buys you little (again, for dexer w/o DevCrit). With single opponents, it's effective. KD has extremely limited use vs. bosses who are often KD-immune and/or high discipline/high STR creatures. But this depends on the magic level of the environment to some degree. On very high magic PWs, KD is essentially a wasted feat altogether since too many monsters have been customized to be KD immune.

Unless you just like KDing baseline creatures and other low discipline/low STR enemies. Then it has some merit in high magic.

I am also assuming you are considering only PvM with your question rather than against the polymorph forms of other PCs.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
foojin wrote:I don't see why you would go 10 monk,
The speed boost (highlighted at the end of the build), the AC & fort saves. This is tied in with your original question about the value of the halfling +AC/+AB/+saves tradeoff vs. KDing huge foes. The additional 4 monk levels addresses this issue +AC/+saves without sacrificing the KD range, essentially empowering the non-halfling with the same hin boni plus faster speed.
i''d rather have more rogue levels then and pick up impr evasion with one of those.
That's an option, but other than Crippling Strike, the only other bonus feats that appeal to me in a build like this is ISA. For a cleric/monk, Will saves should not be an issue. One thing to watch is that your HP is very low for a melee toon. With ED you won't be getting hit as often, but when you do, it will hurt with less than 400 HP. More rogue levels= lower HP total. Pray that your cleric buffs hold (Endurance, specifically) or it may get hairy, especially if flanked by sneakers and/or DAer's. I would feel more comfortable with War domain but apparently that isn't an option on your server. Also, if choosing only one metamagic feat, I would choose Empowered for the added power-up. I would rather crit twice as often than rely on extended spells, my preference.
Your 2 AB gain is really nice though, but the armor skin feels lackluster since it already goes to around 70+ AC and has epic dodge to boot.
Again... back to your original question about the halfling race boni. If you were really only concerned about AB, then just ignore the other boosts in your evaluation comparison.
Also with my build i still get the 9th level spells, which is nice at times.
Define "nice". No exalted build is structured around handy attributes, not without sacrificing power.
My only concern right now it the low AB of 36, this maxed my dual wield / flurry ab at 58. Calculation: 36 (base) +6 (gear) +20 (AB CAP) - 4 (flurry/DW). I'd really would have liked to be on 60 at all times but i guess that won't happen.
Why? What enemies won't you hit respectfully even at 50? For those bosses with uber AC, even 60 won't matter that much and you will be hitting primarily on 20's anyway.

MY concern would be hitting while unbuffed. All it takes is one minor dispel or an enemy with an OnHit: Dispel weapon and you will be swinging in the air.

About Disable Trap ranks: Any more than 16 modified ranks is a total waste on any server with vanilla traps. If you want your toon to be able to disarm epic traps, you'll need 38 modified ranks. Anything value between these 2 is wasted skill points. For PvP disarming, you'd need Trickery domain, LOTS more cleric levels, maxed disable trap and both skill foci and even then the trapsetter ALWAYS has the advantage. For servers with custom trap DCs, assess & try to disarm a few that you know the standard DC, note the difference and add that many more ranks to the mundane 16 level. MOST times, designers apply the same DC bias for all trap customizations. Just a suggestion.

foojin wrote:And as for slippery mind, well i tend to roll allot of ones, and sometimes i just have to go afk for 2+ minutes because of it's insane duration.

I just find it dumb to get a 1+50 (cause thats what it will end up at) and still get feared, it's just bollocks.
Well, Clarity does not increase Will saves, it is an immunity against mind-affecting effects so rolls mean nothing. But there are other ways of dealing with fear like Protection from Alignment (yes, you can quickslot both evil AND good versions if you like... handy against those gold dragons with fear aura), any of the Lesser/Mind Blank scrolls (may as well start using that UMD investment, eh?) and believe it or not, if your cleric can brew potions of Remove Fear he can actually drink a potion while feared and cure himself. But the spell itself won't target while feared. Just a few ways of bypassing fear without pally levels.

I agree, though. Fear is one of the most annoying spells in the game which is why I never cast it and spend the next 10 minutes chasing all the enemies around the screen trying to swat them. They could have at least halved the dang duration.

posts.content:
HipMaestro wrote:[...] and believe it or not, if your cleric can brew potions of Remove Fear he can actually drink a potion while feared and cure himself.
Really? I didn't know it was possible to drink potions while frightened. I could have sworn that I tried drinking potions of clarity in the OC while getting chased around the warrens by a mummy in the Beggar's Nest. That would be a very handy thing to know. Or, is this specific to a PW and I missed the context earlier in the thread?

I totally agree that Fear can be very annoying, both as a user and a victim. I was looking for a nice mid-level spell for crowd control that would take advantage of my wizard's GSF:Necromancy. I quickly relegated Fear for use when I am in real trouble since chasing mobs all over the map gets tedious in a hurry. It's also a problem with undead encounters when traveling with a cleric henchie.

BTW, regarding failing saves versus fear auras and so on, I have gotten lucky a couple times with stealthy characters who weren't already in combat by going into stealth mode when entering (or being impinged upon by) the fear aura. My character ran around a corner (out of line of sight) and the baddy stopped following until I regained control. Not reliable, by any means, and possibly only effective since I was hasted, but it's at least some chance of being able to wait out the storm and it costs nothing to use.
